author: LC Duplatt
full_text:

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@...> wrote:
>
> 
> I have always used this Sony Walkman the past several years to 
bring 
> to the ball game with me and it's by far the best sounding radio 
i've 
> ever had.  Well, i was cleaning up today and came across it.  I 
> turned it on and just held down the scan button and it scans 
through 
> all the stations non-stop as long as you keep it pressed down.  
Which 
> is no big deal since the recorded sessions for me are only usually 
10 
> Min. tops. This model has been out for years and you can pick it up 
> at your local Circuit city or Best buy, it's even on Ebay for $20.  
> Circuit city i think is like $30.  You have to plug headphones into 
> it or an external speaker, but it fits in the palm of your hand and 
> the reception is better than all the rest.  It runs off of 1 AAA 
> battery and lasts forever.  For those who are afraid to hack a 
radio, 
> just pick this model up and hold the scan button down and away you 
go 
> right out of the packaging.  I did open it up and there is a 
ribbon, 
> but nothing was clearly marked so i will have to find the 
schematics 
> online before i mess with it.  The radio has AM/FM/WB/TV, however 
> when i did the trial scans i found that the AM worked best and 
> instantly received answers to my questions.  I turned it on and 
asked 
> if this is working and loud and clear they said "yes".  Oh, it's 
> model # SRF-M37V.
> 
> I'll post more when the ideas hit me.
> 
> -Steve H.
>
